intro: Vandenboschia mettenii, commonly known as the Kgalagadi tussock, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that forms dense, tufted clumps with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters during the rainy season. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Vandenboschia mettenii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals and insects.
